intro: Hedyotis deltoidea, commonly known as the delta knotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a small shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The small white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, and the plant produces small, dark berries as fruit.
